intro: Crepis libanotica, commonly known as the Lebanon cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and basal leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a single head, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as slopes and meadows. Crepis libanotica is an herbaceous perennial that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native environment.
